subject: Business
title: The Time Value of Money
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Time Value of Money usable.

hook.text: Would you rather have $100 today or $100 a year from now? The answer reveals a fundamental financial law.

buildup.text: The time value of money says a dollar today is worth more than a dollar tomorrow because it can be invested.

discovery.text: Present value calculates what future money is worth today. $1,000 in five years at 5% is worth $783.53 today.

twist.text: This concept explains why lotteries offer lower lump sums than annuity totals. The lump sum today can grow.

climax.text: Every investment decision, mortgage calculation, and retirement plan is built on the time value of money.

punchline.text: A dollar today beats a dollar tomorrow. Every time.

quiz.question: Why is $100 today worth more than $100 in one year?
options: Because $100 today can be invested and grow over the year
Because prices always decrease over time
Because banks charge fees on future money
